hanzi-su-wiki:
尿

Значения

Моча

Мнемоника

Человек в сидячей позе 尸 и вода 水 под ним. Мочиться.

heisig_chinese_memo: Animals use their urine (body water) like a flag to mark their territory.
koohiiStory1: Animals use their urine to mark their territory. So for them, their body water works as a flag denoting their "country" (why bother? we all know which story you are going to pick).
koohiiStory2: Someone is pissing on the American flag, but since the urine is clear it looks like water.
jp_example_words:
屎尿(しにょう): excreta, raw sewage, human waste, night soil
尿(にょう): urine
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you go to the pool or lake to swim, you'll see a flag stuck somewhere in the water. That flag is there so you know it's okay to pee in that area of the pool. Everyone knows urine dilutes in water, and if everyone just pees in one place, it won't be gross. So go pee over by that flag when you have to go. Don't bother getting out of the water.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine swimming over to the flag that's sticking out of the water and peeing there. Yeah, everyone knows what you're doing over there, but it's better than getting out and walking to the bathroom right? Just pee in the water. Just do it.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Right as you start to pee, you hear the life guard start to yell, "NYOOOOOO! (にょう)" and he's pointing at you! You were just peeing by the pee flag! Why is he mad?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine your embarrassment when you find out that you aren't supposed to urinate in the water, not even by the pee flag, because a life guard yelled NYOOOOOO and pointed right at you while you did it.

humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle starts from " human " from a small point (indicated by ◎), like a side view of a person urinating. The original meaning is to urinate and excrete urination. It also refers to urination. It is extended to refer to the fluid excreted by the kidneys of humans or animals. Xiaozhuan changed from " tail " from " water ". "Said Wen. "Tail": "Urine, people urinate. From the tail, from the water." Xu Hao's note: "Today's proverb, urine is cut, read Ruo Sui." " Urine " except for "slave hanging cut" (ie Mandarin niao4, Cantonese niu6 ) In addition to one sound, there is another sound. Xu Hao in the Qing Dynasty was from Panyu, Guangdong. He pointed out that the proverb for " urine " was "xiyiqie", pronounced as " sui ". This sound corresponds to the popular Cantonese call " urine " today It is syu4 (pronounced " sweet potato "), especially when calling children to pee, they will say "syushu". In dialects, peeing is also called "屙urine".

The word " urine " was also expressed by the word " drow " in the past, "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu": "Many ancient books are fake." "The Biography of Li Lu Zhu Liu Shu Sun": "Pei Gong does not like Confucianism, and the guests who come to the Confucianism, Pei Gong confuses his crown and drowns in it." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Drown, read urine." It means that Liu Bang does not like scholars. If there were scholars wearing hats among the guests, Liu Bang would take off their hats and pee on them.

The oracle bone inscription means peeing, and 137 of "Compilation" is positive: "Feng pee is in 彔 (Lu)." " Feng " is the name of a person, meaning Feng peeing at the foot of the mountain. It also means urinary disease, which is equivalent to today's diseases such as prostatitis, urethral disease, bladder disease, and prostate disease (see Yan Yiping), "Compilation" 13887: "Zhen: Urine is a disease of the shoulder. "The meaning of "shoulder xing with disease" means "to overcome with disease" (Cai Zhemao), which means that urinary disease will not get better.
humanum_short_description_en: " Urine " is like a person peeing. The original meaning is to urinate.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「人」從小點（以◎表示），象一人在小便的側視圖，本義是撒尿、排泄小便，又指小便，引申為人或動物經腎臟過濾排泄出的液體。小篆改為從「尾」從「水」。《說文．尾部》：「尿，人小便也。从尾，从水。」徐灝箋：「今俗語尿息遺切，讀若綏。」「尿」除了「奴弔切」（即普通話niao4，粵語niu6）一音外，還有一個音，清朝的徐灝是廣東番禺人，他指出「尿」的俗音是「息遺切」，讀若「綏」，此音對應今天粵語俗呼「尿」為syu4（音同「薯」），尤其在呼喚小孩撒尿時，會說「屙薯薯」。在方言中，撒尿又叫「屙尿」。

　　「尿」字過去也借「溺」字表示，《說文解字注》：「古書多假溺為之。」《漢書．酈陸朱劉叔孫傳》：「沛公不喜儒，諸客冠儒來者，沛公輒解其冠，溺其中。」顏師古注：「溺，讀曰尿。」意謂劉邦不喜歡讀書人，客人中若有戴帽子的讀書人，劉邦便摘下他們的帽子，在上面撒尿。

　　甲骨文表示撒尿，《合集》137正：「豐尿于彔（麓）」，「豐」是人名，意謂豐在山腳撒尿。又表示尿病，相當於今天的前列腺炎、尿道病、膀胱病、攝護腺病一類的疾病（參嚴一萍），《合集》13887：「貞：尿，弗其肩興㞢（有）疾。」「肩興有疾」的意義是「克興有疾」（蔡哲茂），意謂貞卜尿病，不會好轉。
humanum_short_description: 「尿」象一人在撒尿，本義是排泄小便。

甲骨文從「 人 」從小點（以◎表示），象一人在小便的側視圖，本義是撒尿、排泄小便，又指小便，引申為人或動物經腎臟過濾排泄出的液體。小篆改為從「 尾 」從「 水 」。《說文．尾部》：「尿，人小便也。从尾，从水。」徐灝箋：「今俗語尿息遺切，讀若綏。」「 尿 」除了「奴弔切」（即普通話niao4，粵語niu6）一音外，還有一個音，清朝的徐灝是廣東番禺人，他指出「 尿 」的俗音是「息遺切」，讀若「 綏 」，此音對應今天粵語俗呼「 尿 」為syu4（音同「 薯 」），尤其在呼喚小孩撒尿時，會說「屙薯薯」。在方言中，撒尿又叫「屙尿」。 「 尿 」字過去也借「 溺 」字表示，《說文解字注》：「古書多假溺為之。」《漢書．酈陸朱劉叔孫傳》：「沛公不喜儒，諸客冠儒來者，沛公輒解其冠，溺其中。」顏師古注：「溺，讀曰尿。」意謂劉邦不喜歡讀書人，客人中若有戴帽子的讀書人，劉邦便摘下他們的帽子，在上面撒尿。 甲骨文表示撒尿，《合集》137正：「豐尿于彔（麓）」，「 豐 」是人名，意謂豐在山腳撒尿。又表示尿病，相當於今天的前列腺炎、尿道病、膀胱病、攝護腺病一類的疾病（參嚴一萍），《合集》13887：「貞：尿，弗其肩興㞢（有）疾。」「肩興有疾」的意義是「克興有疾」（蔡哲茂），意謂貞卜尿病，不會好轉。

It is extended to refer to the fluid excreted by the kidneys of humans or animals. Xiaozhuan changed from " tail" from " water". "Said Wen. "Tail": "Urine, people urinate. From the tail, from the water." Xu Hao's note: "Today's proverb, urine is cut, read Ruo Sui." " Urine" except for "slave hanging cut" (ie Mandarin niao4, Cantonese niu6 ) In addition to one sound, there is another sound. Xu Hao in the Qing Dynasty was from Panyu, Guangdong. He pointed out that the proverb for " urine" was "xiyiqie", pronounced as " sui". This sound corresponds to the popular Cantonese call " urine" today It is syu4 (pronounced " sweet potato"), especially when calling children to pee, they will say "syushu". In dialects, peeing is also called "屙urine". The word " urine" was also expressed by the word " drow" in the past, "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu": "Many ancient books are fake." "The Biography of Li Lu Zhu Liu Shu Sun": "Pei Gong does not like Confucianism, and the guests who come to the Confucianism, Pei Gong confuses his crown and drowns in it." Yan Shi Gu's note: "Drown, read urine." It means that Liu Bang does not like scholars. If there were scholars wearing hats among the guests, Liu Bang would take off their hats and pee on them. The oracle bone inscription means peeing, and 137 of "Compilation" is positive: "Feng pee is in 彔 (Lu)." " Feng" is the name of a person, meaning Feng peeing at the foot of the mountain. It also means urinary disease, which is equivalent to today's diseases such as prostatitis, urethral disease, bladder disease, and prostate disease (see Yan Yiping), "Compilation" 13887: "Zhen: Urine is a disease of the shoulder. "The meaning of "shoulder xing with disease" means "to overcome with disease" (Cai Zhemao), which means that urinary disease will not get better.

尿字的基本解释

尿
niào
小便，肾脏的排泄液：尿液。尿布。尿肥。尿素。
排泄小便：尿尿。

尿
suī
小便（限于名词）：尿（ni刼 ）尿。尿脬（膀胱。亦作“尿泡”）。

尿字的汉语字典释义

[①]［niào］
［《廣韻》奴弔切，去嘯，泥。］
(1)小便。人或动物体内由肾脏产生从尿道排泄出来的液体。
(2)排泄小便，撒尿。
(3)方言。犹理会。
[②]［suī］
［《六書故》息遺切］
小便。作名词用。

尿字的英文翻译

◎ 尿
emiction, stale, urine

尿字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【尸字部】　尿； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页300第20
【廣韻】【集韻】?奴弔切，鳥去聲。【說文】人小便也。今亦作溺。

尿字的源字形

尿字的起名意思

暂无。

尿
乡
尿
T康
甲骨文
(niào)
一个站着撒尿的男人側 面像,看来男性
小便的姿势千百年来都没有改变过。
小篆
尿
“尿”,是个会意字,本义就是小便。《说文》中解释为“尿,人小便也”。
甲骨文的“尿”字,形态上就像是一个侧向站立正在撒尿的男子,左下方斜向
的三点就表示“尿”。小篆的字形变得复杂了,上面是“尾”,下面是“水”。
“尿”用作动词,意思是撒尿。在古文中,“尿”还常用“溺”来代替。
隶书
尿
楷体
Пописать
городок
Пописать
Т Канг
(niào)
Профильный портрет мужчины, стоящего и писающего. Кажется, что поза мужчины, который мочится, не изменилась за тысячи лет.
Пописать
«Моча» - это знающее слово, и его первоначальное значение - мочиться.
В «Shuowen» это объясняется как «Моча, люди мочатся».
Слово «моча» в надписях на костях Oracle напоминает человека, стоящего боком и писающего. Три диагональные точки в левом нижнем углу обозначают «мочу».
Характерная форма Сяочжуаня усложнилась: верхняя часть - «хвост», а нижняя - «вода».
«Моча» используется как глагол, означающий мочиться.
В древнем Китае слово «моча» часто заменяется словом «утопление».
Пописать
Курсив
niào, suī
1) niào моча
2) niào мочиться; обмочить
尿裤子 обмочить штаны, обмочиться
尿床 мочиться в постель
3) suī см. 尿泡 и 尿脬
Radicals: 尸, 水  (flag, water)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you go to the pool or lake to swim, you'll see a flag stuck somewhere in the water. That flag is there so you know it's okay to pee in that area of the pool. Everyone knows urine dilutes in water, and if everyone just pees in one place, it won't be gross. So go pee over by that flag when you have to go. Don't bother getting out of the water.
Imagine swimming over to the flag that's sticking out of the water and peeing there. Yeah, everyone knows what you're doing over there, but it's better than getting out and walking to the bathroom right? Just pee in the water. Just do it.
Reading Mnemonic
Right as you start to pee, you hear the life guard start to yell, "NYOOOOOO! (にょう)" and he's pointing at you! You were just peeing by the pee flag! Why is he mad?
Imagine your embarrassment when you find out that you aren't supposed to urinate in the water, not even by the pee flag, because a life guard yelled NYOOOOOO and pointed right at you while you did it.

尸 (труп), 水 (вода)
